Nisi Prius.definition: a court of record that tries an issue of fact before a jury and a single judge
Nisi Prius.origin: [Medieval Latin, unless before, the words introducing a clause in an English writ commanding a sheriff to provide a jury at the Court of Westminster on a certain day unless the judges of assize previously come to the county from which the jury is to be returned]

1.1: a court of record that tries an issue of fact before a jury and a single judge

3.1: the proceedings in such a court

4.1: the conducting of jury trials [long-distance travel eliminated the
4.nisi prius: practice of the justices "W. J. Brennan, Jr."]
